TopicTitle: Pushing a semi-transparent mesh into Unity

Articles.Content:
Good afternoon everyone,

I have a question that, after searching for a few hours, cannot find the answer/forum for.

Also, I am fairly new to anything in Unity or Blender. Though, I am able to create models and push them over to Unity with some success.

I am creating a dome, "bio-dome", if you will. I have no issues creating a base for the dome or models which are opaque inside the dome.

My issue comes when I create a semi-transparent (bluish) hue for the dome. Every time I port the model from blender to unity, I either get a completely blue dome or none at all (completely transparent).

I want to say that I'm missing something obvious, but I'm lost here.

Any help is good help!

Thank you!
What shader are you selecting? It should work OK with one of the KSP->Alpha->Translucent options.
